pull.title: doc: Change README_windows to Markdown
pull.body: To make it more coherent with the other README files in the doc/ folder

events.body:
Please fix any trailing whitespace issues, see linter output [here](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/423605915).

You'll also need to update any instances where this file is used, such as in [share/setup.nsi.in](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/271b379e636afa419c5208cb462c07090490266c/share/setup.nsi.in#L79) or [Makefile.am](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/77168f766f15c6621fb2af0dfcf2dd12b971172c/Makefile.am#L56).

I'm wondering if there was a Windows specific reason the readme was left as a `.txt` file?
I am not sure it is good to fix the linter issue. When we change `\r\n` to `\n`, it will show just one line if it is opened by Windows built-in notepad.

events.message: Fixed filename in Makefile and NSI script

events.body: @fanquake Thanks for that reminder I updated it. I also done `grep -rn README_windows.txt` to be 100% sure.
I am NACK about the line ending change thing. IMO it just need to add a file list into the linter to not check `\r\n`.

NACK

Leave it `.txt` please. This file is intended to be opened in notepad (as it is packaged with the binary distribution), changing the extension/layout does nothing to help windows users.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,23 +1,18 @@
-Bitcoin Core
-=============
-
-Intro
------
-Bitcoin is a free open source peer-to-peer electronic cash system that is
-completely decentralized, without the need for a central server or trusted
-parties.  Users hold the crypto keys to their own money and transact directly
-with each other, with the help of a P2P network to check for double-spending.
-
-
-Setup
------
-Unpack the files into a directory and run bitcoin-qt.exe.
-
-Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client and it builds the backbone of the network.
-However, it downloads and stores the entire history of Bitcoin transactions;
-depending on the speed of your computer and network connection, the synchronization
-process can take anywhere from a few hours to a day or more.
-
-See the bitcoin wiki at:
-  https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Main_Page
-for more help and information.
+# Bitcoin Core
+
+### Intro
comments.body: ```doc/README_windows.md:3: MD001 Header levels should only increment by one level at a time```

+# Bitcoin Core
+
+### Intro
+Bitcoin is a free open source peer-to-peer electronic cash system that is
+completely decentralized, without the need for a central server or trusted
+parties.  Users hold the crypto keys to their own money and transact directly
+with each other, with the help of a P2P network to check for double-spending.
+
+
+### Setup
+Unpack the files into a directory and run bitcoin-qt.exe.
+
+Bitcoin Core is the original Bitcoin client and it builds the backbone of the network.
+However, it downloads and stores the entire history of Bitcoin transactions;
+depending on the speed of your computer and network connection, the synchronization
+process can take anywhere from a few hours to a day or more.
+
+See the bitcoin wiki [here](https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Main_Page) for more help and information.
